page.title: 16TRANSPORT - THE MICROBUS
page.content: This is a new kind of Local Authority transport which replaces the usual 75-seater double-decker buses with{12-seater mini-buses. }These Micros, unlike the normal buses, do not follow fixed routes. Their routes are from{Easterhouse Shopping Centre to wherever the passengers wish to go ( within the limits of the local boundaries ). The demand for Micros arose due to the distance passengers had to walk from bus stops to their homes, and also the high cost ot Taxi fares. A fixed fare of 50p is charged (comparing very favourably with the Â£1.50 plus charged by taxis). A group of neighbours may book the Micro to uplift them at a given time and return to collect them when their shopping is finished.
